data.title: Dorian GRAY'S Portrait

data.text:
DORIAN GRA Y'S PORTRAIT

1. Lord Henry is by profession:

to. Painter b. Scientific

c. Mysterious d. Critical

2. How did Basil Hallward and Doria n Gray meet ?:

In a party

3. Lord Henry stroked his b lack beard as he tapped the heel of his leather boot w ith an ebony

cane. T he underlined word means:

to. Woo d colour b. Fine material

c. Black leather d. Cold wood

4. When Lord Henry met Dorian Gray , he said: -Y ou are too charming to dedicate yourself to

philanthropy . Mr . Gray ... too charming. I t can be inferred that the word Philant hropy means:

to. T endency to selflessly pursue p eople's good

b. Person who is dedicated to pl aying instruments under no instruction

c. Suff ix element meaning sympathy , hobby

d. Person who believes himself to be a model in paper that serves as a pattern for making

fashion strictly .

5. Who was the person who most influenced Dorian Gray to make him so cold or feel like a

god?

to. Basil b. Lord Henry

c. Lord's aunt d. Parker

6. Dorian Gray expresses to Basil: -I am jealous of what has an imperishable beauty . I am

jealous of your portrait of me. What strength allows you to keep what I am going to lose?

Every minute that passes takes something from me, and gives something to the painting.

What do you mean b y the expression: "What strength allows you to keep what I am going to

lose?"

to. Joy b. Y our jealousy

c. The l ove of both d. Y outh

7. Old bachelor with rough manners, strong but friendly character . V ery wealthy , he managed

the English blue book Uncle George, he was the one who told him all the origin of Dorian

Gray What is the history of Dorian G ray?

Lord Henry tells Dorian a phrase about youth that really marks him and there he realizes that

he does not want to grow old and makes a "wish" in front of his portrait and that is when the

portrait begins to age for him wh ile he continues having the same youthfu l appearance.

8. Who is Margaret Debereaux?

to. Beautiful and charming woman, m other of Dorian Gray

b. Wicked and miserable woman, she was a n ambassador for Madrid

c. Woma n who supplied information to old and ne w friends of Lord Henry

d. A w oman who only wrote checks for the poor

9. Lord Henry has a very particular characteristic. It refers to the most recognized by Dorian

and some friends:

to. Bad friend b. Untimely

c. Selfish d. Boring
